questions.text:
I’m showing four fingers.
My two hands are raised high.
My shirt isn’t gold,
so I’m the other guy.

Of the three people that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
What are two things
a plant needs to grow?
Look at the pictures.
Can you find them below?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am not the first,
but I am close to C.
I am next to F,
but I am not G.

Of the letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I warn you it’s poison.
Don’t touch me, stay away!
Tell your parents when you see me,
and they’ll make sure you’re okay.

Of the three pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
I’m taller than Amy,
so I’m not the smallest.
I’m taller than Dion,
but I’m not the tallest.

Of the four people that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
These pictures tell a story,
but not in the order you see.
Which group shows the right order?
Which group must it be?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Two of us have the same shape.
We’re as tall as we are wide.
I’m turned on my corner
instead of on my side.

Of the four things that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Of the four groups
that you see,
which one is ordered
alphabetically?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
With one I make two.
With two I make three.
Of the four numbers that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
In each pair of pictures,
you will see
from the first picture in the box
what the next one should be.

One picture is missing.  It is one of these below.
Touch the missing picture as soon as you know.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Say fire and fish.
The first sound is the same.
Say fox and feather.
What is this letter’s name?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
These pictures tell a story,
but not in the order you see.
Which group shows the right order?
Which group must it be?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
This little shape is lost.
Her family is below.
Which group did she come from?
Where should this shape go?

Choose the place where she should go.
Do you see it, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
See how each pair is alike,
then you’ll know what to find.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Nut, nail, and nose
all begin with the same sound.
In what word below
is this beginning sound found?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Kim is second in line.
Yuki is at the end.
Dave is two ahead of me.
So choose the person I must be.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
These pictures tell a story,
but not in the order you see.
Which group shows the right order?
Which group must it be?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Say pig and pumpkin.
The first sound is the same.
Say pin and pizza.
What is this letter’s name?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I have one hand on my side,
and one hand on my shoe.
I’m sitting on a rectangle
with three sides that are blue.

Of the four pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
A shark has so many.
A toddler has a few.
You will lose your first set
as the second pushes through.

Of the three objects that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Ball, bag, and bee
all begin with the same sound.
In what word below
is this beginning sound found?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
There are two in this family and no more.
They have straight lines two, three, or four.
Of the different shapes that you see,
which two shapes must these two be?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
See how each pair is alike,
then you’ll know what to find.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Say tie and turtle.
The first sound is the same.
Say tent and toaster.
What is this letter’s name?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
These circles have a pattern.
Look at each one in the row.
Which circle is the next one?
Can you find it below?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
This big animal is lost.
His home is below.
Choose the place where he lives,
as soon as you think you know.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I have three blocks,
and Jo has two blocks more.
Of the groups you see below,
which are the blocks that belong to Jo?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I am a place to go
when you want to eat.
You look at the menu
when you take a seat.

Of the four things that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
Three of my gills are easy to see.
My belly is colored white.
My open mouth shows seven teeth,
and I am turned to the right.

Of the four sharks that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am less than eight,
but I am more than three.
I’m a number below.
Which number must I be?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
We need a picture to finish this story.
It’s one of these below.
Choose the one you think it is,
as soon as you think you know.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Sink, saddle, and soap
all begin with the same sound.
In what word below
is this beginning sound found?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I am on the right,
and I have lost a shoe.
I have both my socks.
I’m dressed in orange and blue.

Of the four people that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
Joe spends the day at the city pound
counting the animals that have been found.
Of all the animals that he must count,
this one is the largest amount.

Of the four choices you see below,
choose the answer when you know.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I can outrun a horse,
and I stand eight feet high.
I have large wings,
but I cannot fly.

Of the four pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am a number
that comes after four.
I am greater than six
by only two more.

Of the four numbers that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Rhyming words sound alike,
words like hike, Mike, and bike.
Find a word that rhymes with cot
and also rhymes with not and hot.
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I’m next to a shape.
Can you figure out where?
I’m under a triangle
and left of a square.

Of the four pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
A toad ate a beetle.
A lizard ate the toad.
A hawk ate the lizard
when it tried to cross the road.

Of the four pictures that you see,
which shows the end of this story?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
These balls have a pattern.
Look at each ball in the row.
Which ball should come next?
Can you find it below?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I begin each word.
Listen carefully:
fan, feather, fire.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Each student picked a favorite fruit
and placed it with the rest.
Apples, oranges, bananas, or pears-
which fruit was liked the best?

Of the four fruits that you see,
which kind of fruit must this be?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There’s one you must find.
The clue is in the pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am on the inside,
one of two girls on the right.
I have yellow hair and socks,
and my tee shirt’s blue and white.

Of all the girls that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
In this group is a brown moose.
On top of him sits a white goose.
Underneath the moose is a gray rat.
Beside the rat is a brown bat.

Of the four groups that you see,
which group must these four be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
These figures have a pattern.
Is it shape, size, or color?

Which figure should come next?
What pattern can you discover?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Rhyming words sound the same,
words like game, tame, and name.
Find the word that rhymes with chime
and also climb, time, and dime.
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I picked one more than three.
Gus picked one less than that.
Count the apples we picked together,
then choose that number
if you think you’re clever.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
These pictures show a pattern.
Look at each one in the row.
What should the next picture be?
It is one of these below.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I begin each word.
Listen carefully:
goat, girl, gum.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Chu has 3 pennies.
Jeremy has two dimes.
Lupe has three nickels,
but one of them is mine.

Of Jeremy, Chu, Lupe, and me,
which of us has the most money?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Bill ate part of the apple,
then left half for his friend Jim.
Jim ate half of what was left
and saved the rest for Tim.

Look at the pictures of this healthy treat,
then choose the one that Tim got to eat.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
It rained all day,
then rained all night.
Then finally there
was bright sunlight.

Which group of pictures that you see
tells what happened in this story?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Rhyming words have the same sound,
words like found, mound, pound, and round.
Look for a word like hope and slope,
a word below that rhymes with rope.
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I am dressed for winter,
for a walk through the snow.
It’s nighttime in the woods,
but the sky is all aglow.

Of the four pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
Jim’s shirts are in the blue circle.
The green circle shirts are worn by Joe.
How many shirts are worn by both boys?
The answer can be seen below.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There’s one you must find.
The clue is in the pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I end these words.
Listen carefully:
shirt, hat, cat.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Jim wears socks that have some red.
Zach wears socks that have some blue.
How many socks can both boys share?
The socks in both circles are your clue.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
These pictures show a pattern.
Look at each one in the row.
What should the next picture be?
It is one of these below.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
There once was an ogre
who had a naughty dog.
It chased a little piglet,
then met an angry hog.

Of the four pictures that you see,
which shows the end of this story?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
A boy left half a cookie.
The dog ate half of that.
His sister found what was left
and gave it to the cat.

Of the pictures that you see,
which shows who had the most cookie?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I am a mommy.
My daughter has brown hair.
She has two daughters,
Sue Ann and little Claire.

Look at the people in my family,
then tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
These figures have a pattern.
Is it shape, size, or color?

Which figure should come next?
Look below to discover!
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I end these words.
Listen carefully:
bed, hand, bird.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
See how each pair is alike.
Then you’ll know what to find.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I am found in cat.
I am found in rat.
You can hear my name
when you say cake and game.

Of the four letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
See how each pair is alike,
then you’ll know what to find.
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
I’m driving a racing car,
I can hear my engine whine.
I’m not first or second,
but the third one to cross the line.

Of the four cars that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
This little animal is lost.
Her group is below.
See how each family is alike
to see where she should go.

Choose the place where she should go,
once you know why it’s so.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I begin each word.
Listen carefully:
doll, dog, doctor.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
The bag tipped over
and spilled on the floor.
What must have happened
to the bag just before?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
The moon was rising.
It was round and bright.
Then two clouds appeared
in the star-filled night.

Which pair of pictures that you see
tells what happened in this story?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
This little shape is lost.
Her family is below.
Which group did she come from?
Where should this shape go?

Choose the place where she should go.
Do you see it, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Even though the ribbon was tied,
Ed figured out that flowers were inside.
Which of his senses did Ed use?
Which of these answers do you choose?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am found in the middle
of map, cat, and ran.
I’m also found in the middle
of mad, ham, and fan.

Of the four letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Look at each pair of pictures.
There are always two of a kind.
See how each pair is alike,
then you’ll know what to find.
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
On the left is a big striped cat
who always wears a purple hat.
On the right is a green and white frog
who rides atop a shaggy dog.

Of the four groups that you see,
which group must this one be?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
These pictures show a pattern.
Look at each one in the row.
What should the next picture be?
It is one of these below.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I end these words.
Listen carefully:
pig, rug, plug.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
This animal is lost.
Her group is below.
See how each family is alike
to find where she should go.

Choose where the animal should go.
Do you see it, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
This machine eats dots.
It is a special tool.
See what goes in and out.
Can you figure out its rule?

Look at the last dots going in.
What will come out the other end?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Stay away from me
when you see who I am.
I warn you of danger
whenever I can.

Of the three pictures that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
These are not fish,
but they live in the sea.
They can’t breathe underwater.
Which three must they be?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I am found in the middle
of run, cup, and bug.
I’m also found in the middle
of sun, pup, and hug.

Of the four letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I squeezed two oranges
to fill the glass you see.
How many more must I squeeze
to fill these other three?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
It is the color
of cloudless skies,
a pond and a lake,
and some berry pies.

Of the four words that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Red took a few minutes.
Green and Blue took an hour.
Black took all morning long
to climb the water tower.
They all left together,
never stopping to quench their thirst.

Which of these four climbers
reached the top of the tower first?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
I am found in the middle
of big, pin, and sit.
I’m also found in the middle
of lid, sip, and hit.

Of the four letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I can hold a chicken.
I can hold a ham.
I can hold a turkey.
I’m called a roasting pan.

Of the three pans that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
My meal is half an apple
and a tasty, whole, green pear.
I wish I had more cherries,
but five are all that are there.

Of the four kids that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Mother called, “Come on, sleepyhead.
It’s time to hop out of that bed.”
Allen could tell, without even looking,
bacon was what his mom was cooking.

Which of his senses did Allen use?
Tell me which one you would choose.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
Paige is my sister.
She isn’t next to me.
She’s two years older.
I just turned three.

Look at the girls that you see,
then choose the one Paige must be.
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
Rhyming words sound the same,
words like name, tame, and game.
Listen to thorn, sink, and king.
Which of these words rhyme with thing?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
This big animal is lost.
Her home is below.
Choose the place where she lives,
as soon as you think you know.
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
When she hears the ring,
she runs to the door.
But can you tell me
what happened just before?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
My number is five more than Mel’s.
Mel’s number is three less than Ed’s.
Of the numbers that you see,
which is mine, which one must it be?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I am found in pin
but not in bat.
I am found in win
but not in cat.

Of the four letters that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
This machine eats dots.
It is a special tool.
See what goes in and out.
Can you figure out its rule?

Look at the last dots going in.
What will come out the other end?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
She is not my older sister.
We were born on the same day.
We have two younger sisters,
Mary Sue and Carrie May.

Of all of us you see below,
who are we, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub4

questions.text:
This little shape is lost.
Her family is below.
Which group did she come from?
Where should this shape go?

Choose the place where she should go.
Do you see it, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub1

questions.text:
I am the color
of leaves on trees,
a frog on a pad,
and spinach and peas.

Of the four words that you see,
tell me now, can you find me?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I begin each word.
Listen carefully:
sun, seal, sandwich.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
This animal is lost.
Her group is below.
See how each family is alike
to find where she should go.

Choose where she should go.
Do you see it, do you know?
questions.subject: Sub3

questions.text:
I end each word.
Listen carefully:
mop, lamp, map.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
Rhyming words sound the same,
words like name, tame, and game.
Find the word that rhymes below
with the words go, throw, and crow.
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I end each word.
Listen carefully:
ham, gum, worm.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
On the right is a brown bat
who sits atop a fat, black cat.
On the left is a gray mouse
who stands atop a small, green house.

Of the four groups that you see,
which group must this one be?
questions.subject: Sub2

questions.text:
I end each word.
Listen carefully:
pan, mitten, sun.
Which letter must I be?
questions.subject: Sub2
